course.subject: SBMT
course.name: Business Student Induction
course.description: This is an induction course designed for all new students in the School of Business and Management. Students will be divided into 10 cohorts and assigned to designated academic advisors. They will also be participating in a series of planned activities, aiming to help them build bonds and simultaneously identify personal academic interest, examine educational goals, and develop plans to meet objectives through academic advising and other personal development workshops and programs. Graded P or F.

reviews.author: Qwerty233
reviews.comment_content: MAEC has its own SBMT1111 session, which is different from the rest of SBMT1111. It introduces some general information about maec and ust, e.g. curriculum, career prospects, cga. As a freshman, I think it's quite useful.
reviews.comment_teaching: I think everyone who have attended prof siu's class would admit that his teaching is pretty good -- fluent and informative. Prof kwok seems quite nice.
reviews.comment_grading: P/F. If you didn't complete the eduction plan, you will receive a fail grade.
reviews.comment_workload: No workload. Just 1 compulsory SBMT1111 session, 1 education plan and 1 compulsory advising session. Other sessions are optional.

reviews.author: tzu
reviews.title: Nothing Special
reviews.comment_content:
The content shown in the first 2 lessons are quite straightforward but can be boring since it is things that we've heard since applying for university.

1st Lesson - Academic Advising
If you've done your research before coming to UST then these are things you already know (plus there's a meeting with your academic advisor who literally repeats the same things). Instructor talks about stuff like CGA, Majors, Credits, etc...

2nd Lesson - Mindset, Counsellors, Wellness
Depending on a person, you may find the lecture interesting or boring. Tbh, the information could have been condensed into a 10 minute presentation and could have been delivered in a way better manner.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Allen is the best when it comes to delivering information to a bunch of 18/19 year olds with a short attention span. He tries his best to make the information digestible and often makes references and jokes.

The tutor for the 2nd lesson was trying real hard to sound motivating but just not for me.
reviews.comment_grading:
- P/F Course
- Compulsory to attend the first 2 lessons and the rest are optional
- Do the quizzes for the 2 lessons and you're good to go
reviews.comment_workload:
0 workload, only thing to do are 2 quizzes based off of the inductions (for participation)
You could answer everything wrongly and still pass

reviews.author: Smashgod
reviews.title: Basic and introductory, as the name implies.
reviews.comment_content:
Provides you with basic info about what an SBM student needs, such as past statistics, the main directors, whom to contact when business students have inquiries, to name but a few. Hence, it is not an intriguing course.

In the second lesson, it was all about developing a mindset in university and tackling obstacles, which is by no means exclusive to SBM. They could have given us these tips to all freshmen on other occasions if they insist on doing it.

The 3rd lesson was optional and was about the SBM Major Selection Exercise, which is much more relevant and more informative to business students. I don't want to change my major so I didn't attend the session so I can't comment on how good/bad it was.
reviews.comment_teaching: Decent, but not particularly captivating or impressive. Somehow within our expectations for a real-time online course.
reviews.comment_grading: Nothing to do, so I have no comment.
reviews.comment_workload:
Two short quizzes(mainly a few MC questions about SBM facts)after the first 2 lessons. Can easily be completed by referring to their PowerPoints. Also, a good/bad score makes no difference for you, other than your ego.
Probably no more lessons left after the first 2-3 weeks(It is 1 lesson per week). However, they take your attendance so you must enter the Zoom (although you can turn off your camera)

reviews.author: Sammul
reviews.title: It's really just a brief introduction course, nothing much.
reviews.comment_content:
It is a 0 credit course with the intention to assist freshmen in adapting to the new university life in HKUST. First two lectures in Zoom are compulsory, but the rest are optional. As I do not require much assistance in this aspect, this is basically just a course to sit in and leave twice.

But when I asked the lecturer, she replied me that the results of these quizzes serve no purpose whatsoever. reviews.author: lonelyguy
reviews.comment_content: SBMT 1111 Business Student Induction is an induction course designed for all new students in the School of Business and Management. The course provides a platform for you to adapt to the new academic environment, build connections, and make the most out of the diverse set of academic and co-curricular opportunities that HKUST offers while maintaining a balanced university life. You will also be able to identify your personal academic interest, examine educational goals, and develop plans to meet objectives through academic advising and other personal development workshops and programs.  You will be supported by a designated Academic Affairs and Advising Counselor (AAAC) and Peer Mentor to guide you through the academic landscape.
reviews.comment_teaching:
No teaching. Just listen to some talks inside LTA. Usually it will last for 30-45 minutes each time. They will have some optional sessions talking the following topics as well:

- Exchange and other overseas learning opportunities, internship, social/corporate projects, etc.
- Common Core Program
- Soft skills
- Major Selection

If you are interested in any of those, you need to register for those optional talks in advance.
reviews.comment_grading:
Pass or Fail.

- Attend the first two Course Introduction sessions
- Participate in an Advising Event arranged by your Academic Affairs and Advising Counselor (AAAC)
- Fill in an online form “My Educational Plan” to indicate your academic and co-curricular plans and interests

You will fail this course automatically if you miss any one of them. Just like HLTH 1010, some people will fail the course due to the missing deadlines.
reviews.comment_workload:
There are some required activities that you MUST join as a newbie in UST.

The online form is a quite long so it takes some time to deal with it. As there are many small tasks to do, you may forget the deadline of some of the tasks.

Your AAAC will announce the time slots to meet with him/her. Usually it will be a small group meeting. I registered the time slot that only I registered it and my AAAC asked me to re-arrange the time slot. :( It will last for an hour, discussing the university program, major requirements, school life etc. Nothing very special. You will get another advisor once you have a major.

N/A The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (HKUST) is a public research university in Clear Water Bay Peninsula, Hong Kong. Established in 1991, it is the territory's youngest higher learning institution with no precursory existence.[2][note 1]

The university consists of four disciplinary schools, which offer degrees in business and management, engineering, science, and humanities and social science, alongside the Interdisciplinary Programs Office, which provides cross-disciplinary programs, and Fok Ying Tung Graduate School/Fok Ying Tung Research Institute, which promotes technology transfer and commercialisation.[3] HKUST has been continuously viewed as one of the top three higher education institutions in Hong Kong.[4
